basics.name: Ahmad Abu Turab Naqvi
basics.label: Scientist
basics.summary: A bioinformatician, computational biologist, data scientist and poet.

work.name: CIRBSc, JMI, New Delhi
work.summary: As Bioinformatician, I contributed to the in-silico part of the project which dealt with screening and filtering of potential compounds as inhibitors of MARK4 kinase activity. I performed molecular docking and molecular dynamics simulations to design inhibitors against MARK4. I efficiently used chemoinformatics techniques to screen compounds and performed docking (AutoDock Suit) and MD simulations (GROMACS).

volunteer.summary: Structural and Functional Assignment to Hypothetical Proteins from Common Indian Pathogens.

Thesis: Analysis of Gene Expression Data for Cancer Classification using Artificial Intelligence Techniques.
Funcational Annotation of Hypothetical Proteins from Treponema pallidum.

awards and fellowships.title: ICMR Senior Reserach Fellow
awards and fellowships.awarder: Indian Council of Medical Research, India
awards and fellowships.summary: ICMR awarded me fellowship under the ICMR SRF program for a period of three years (Aug 2019 - Aug 2022).

awards and fellowships.title: JMI Achievers Award
awards and fellowships.summary: For performance in Research and Academics during the year 2022-2023.

publications.name: Pan-cancer analysis of Chromobox (CBX) genes for prognostic significance and cancer classification
publications.publisher: Biochimica et Biophysica Acta (BBA)-Molecular Basis of Disease
publications.summary: Identified high expression of Chromobox genes- CBX2, CBX6, and CBX7 in Cholangiocarcinoma through differential expression analysis and reported CBX2 association with breast cancer via activation of the PI3K/AKT pathway and hepatocellular carcinoma via phosphorylation of YAP protein.

publications.name: How Machine Learning Has Revolutionized the Field of Cancer Informatics?
publications.summary: This chapter aims to give the reader a sense of how machine learning has revolutionized cancer research by making mindful use of enormous cancer data being produced all over the globe.

publications.name: Insights into SARS-CoV-2 genome, structure, evolution, pathogenesis and therapies: Structural genomics approach
publications.publisher: Biochimica et Biophysica Acta (BBA)-Molecular Basis of Disease
publications.summary: The present study highlights the genomic, proteomic, pathogenesis, and therapeutic strategies in SARS-CoV-2 infection. We have carried out sequence analysis of potential drug target proteins in SARS-CoV-2 and, compared them with SARS-CoV and MERS viruses.

references.name: Professor SAM Rizvi
references.reference: Department of Computer Science, Jamia Millia Islamia, New Delhi

references.name: Professor Md. Imtaiyaz Hassan
